body: Used to be a Calc 1 teaching Assistant -- this really smart kid kept coming up to the TA sessions  because he very obviously had a crush on a girl (who would also show up to after-hours). They would both be the only two people in the sessions.  When they needed homework help, I'd ask them to solve the problems together and come to me if they had any questions (while I pretended to catch up on work but actually played GTA on my laptop). Sometimes I'd overhear them talking and getting to know each other -- it was cute. He sure did make my life a hell of a lot easier.

replies.body: Sounds like a win-win to me.

in b4 newspeak.
Newspeak was like the exact opposite this. It aimed to simply language to prohibit complex nuanced thoughts. This here is us trying to express nuanced concepts in a more precise manner.

Ok, so I was going to ignore this ignorant comment, but actually, I think this is important to address, because I’ve seen old pissbaby Graham Lineham make this comparison when it came to cis/trans.

Newspeak was all about removing words. Forcing the people to compress more and more complicated ideas into simpler and simpler language - literally forcing the people to be unable to adequately communicate ideas that went against ingsoc.

What we’re seeing here is an attempt to add further nuance to a language - instead of classing ‘intelligence’ as solely to do with academic achievement is extremely clunky, and actually masks the reality (as we currently understand it) of multiple areas in which our minds can excel.

Frankly, it’s an attempt to get away from the simple, clunky words being used to describe highly complex concepts.

It’s the same with trans and cis. The purpose is to add greater nuance to a language - allowing one to distinguish where necessary, but also combine where more useful. Is it at the same level as the other example? No. Could an argument be made that it obfuscates and erases the ‘natural’ definition of woman? I would very much disagree, but it could be made.

But yeah, to get back to the main point: this is actually the opposite of newspeak. Changing language isn’t automatically wrong, language changes all the time. That’s literally how language works.
Unless of course the girl wasn't interested at all in the smart kid, and just wanted the TA to help her. But I guess we don't know how she felt, or if the smart kid made a pass at her or anything

San Andreas was replaced with a 'remastered' version on Steam back in 2013-2014.  The existing port was replaced with a port of the iOS version of the game and a bunch of songs were removed due to expiring licenses.  It's possible that you and the person you're replying to weren't even playing the same version of the game.

I've only played the pre-remastered version and I've never had problems playing with a kb/m.  I haven't had any reason to play the remastered version because most of the songs that were removed were among my favorite songs in the game.

Hey im 9.
Hello.

You have no idea how much bullshitting teachers get into. There's a limited amount of work we can do while you're working in class so when it runs out (or earlier, some of us are lazy) we get to do some other stuff. I use my free time to check Reddit (shameless plug to my sub, /r/SapphoAndHerFriend) or plan my D&D campaign, which is technically a class activity for the Saturday class so I can get away with it if someone checks. Sometimes I just look at Tumblr screenshots all class while the kids are doing an exam though.

Source: I teach ESL.

I’ve been on the student side of this.

There was this cute girl in my physics class in high school who was struggling with the material, and I was pretty good at it. We were friendly and knew each other through classes and band, but never really got to know each other outside class. I think the teacher thought we would be good together though, because one day he went out of his way to pair me with her when we were going over the homework. He did this a few times, and eventually it turned into tutor sessions after class where we got to know each other really well.

Long story short, we just celebrated our 5th anniversary together. 

Thanks Mr. R!
Did he get an invite to the wedding?
I really hope he does, this was heart warming tbh.

To clarify I meant 5 years since we started dating, not married yet! Very happy though and likely getting married some day down the line. We haven’t had any contact with that teacher since we graduated so probably won’t invite him tbh, but he will always have a special place in our hearts for bringing us together :)
Invite him anyway. Worst case he shows up and gets you a gift.

I'm going to jump on this train too. 

So neither of us were struggling but my AP biology teacher was probably trying to get this girl and I together. Somehow, despite assigned seating being determined by random drawlings (before class by the teacher herself), this girl and I were always seated next to each other. The teacher told me that our two personalities were good together, and she made a point of talking about our plans for going to prom.

I don't know for sure if she was trying to get us together but if she was I was too dumb to figure it out until after graduation.

Me and my SO met in an AP world history class and sat together and her being a girl and me being a sophomore in high school I had a huge crush on her. This was early enough in HS where some teachers would incrementally assign seats. One day I went up to her and asked her if she planned on moving seats she said “yes, do you want that?” And I told her no, and she said “ok then we wont”. 

She totally knew what was up but hey, whatever makes it work.

This post made me wonder if my biology teacher did the same for me in high school! If so, it's even better because his name was Mr. Love. Anyway, we sat at 2-person desks and I remember a seat assignment change a few weeks into the school year and the boy I had a major crush on was moved to sit next to me. I never had the nerve to talk to him until we had to work on assignments together and we totally hit it off. While we didn't end up together, the boy and I ended up being good friends all throughout high school, he took me to my senior homecoming dance, and we have remained friends many years post high school. Thanks Mr. Love!

My best friend's mom is a teacher. I was in her AP bio class as a Junior and had a major crush on this girl in my grade. The next year I had a free hour and she asked me to be a student helper in the class since I did so well on the AP test and in the class.

The girl I had a crush on was in that class, I just helped the other students out with homework but got to interact with her a lot more than I would have. I found out a few years after graduation that she knew I had a crush because she overheard her son and me talking about her when we were hanging playing videogames. The only reason I was I her class as a student helper was because of that. Honestly one of the coolest things a teacher has done for me.
